decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana using cards like High Tide and Candelabra of Tawnos, as well as untap effects like Turnabout and Time Spiral. With this mana advantage, the deck aims to play a big spell like Blue Sun's Zenith to draw a large number of cards or even deck the opponent. Cunning Wish is there to search for answers or additional combo pieces, making this deck a powerful combo-based strategy in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of hand disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. It also aims to control the board with creatures like Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary, while providing protection with Mother of Runes. The deck utilizes mana acceleration with Mox Diamond and mana fixing with dual lands to ensure it can cast its spells efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through a combination of disruption, removal, and efficient threats.

The main concept of this Legacy Faeries Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan using a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and creature threats. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Force of Will and Stifle while also providing card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Vendilion Clique. Tarmogoyf and Grim Lavamancer provide strong creature pressure, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor acts as a finisher. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana sources for the spells in the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By using a mix of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland helps to keep the opponent's board in check, while cards like Dark Confidant and Sensei's Divining Top provide card advantage and selection. Overall, the deck aims to grind out incremental advantages and win through attrition.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly using cards such as Cabal Ritual, Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal, in order to cast cards like Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony to win the game through a storm combo. The deck also includes cards like Brainstorm, Duress, and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to efficiently and effectively assemble the necessary pieces to combo off and win the game as quickly as possible.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategies while maintaining board presence through efficient removal and powerful creatures. The deck aims to control the game through cards like Swords to Plowshares and Vindicate, while also being able to disrupt the opponent's hand with Thoughtseize. Additionally, the deck utilizes efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary to apply pressure and maintain a strong board presence. Overall, the deck focuses on strategic decision-making and resource management to outplay and outlast the opponent.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp using cards like Breakthrough and Careful Study. Once the graveyard is stocked, the deck can utilize cards like Dread Return to reanimate powerful creatures like Flame-Kin Zealot or Sphinx of Lost Truths. Additionally, Bridge from Below can create an army of zombies when creatures are put into the graveyard, providing additional pressure on the opponent. With the right setup, this deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of graveyard synergy and powerful creatures.

This Aggro - Affinity deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By combining creatures like Memnite, Myr Enforcer, and Ornithopter with powerful artifacts like Cranial Plating and Arcbound Ravager, the deck aims to quickly amass a board presence and deal significant damage. Signal Pest and Galvanic Blast also provide additional support for the artifact-based strategy. With mana acceleration from Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, the deck can rapidly deploy its threats and push for a fast victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a high amount of mana using cards such as High Tide and Candelabra of Tawnos, enabling the player to cast big spells like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes a lot of cantrip spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain for card selection and to dig for combo pieces. Cunning Wish is included to tutor for specific answers or combo pieces from the sideboard. The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana and win the game through a powerful combo or overwhelming the opponent with big creatures.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly bring out powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Progenitus onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell and Natural Order. The deck also includes some card advantage and protection spells like Force of Will and Brainstorm to help maintain control and accelerate the combo. Additionally, ramp creatures like Noble Hierarch and mana acceleration lands allow for faster casting of big threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around cheating in big creatures and overwhelming the opponent with their power and speed.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent by playing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Tombstalker while disrupting their game plan with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Force of Will. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Stifle and Daze to counter opponent's spells and abilities. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Engineered Explosives and Jace, the Mind Sculptor while digging for more threats and answers with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base is designed to ensure smooth mana fixing and access to all necessary colors.

The deck focuses on establishing a strong board presence with Thopter tokens created by the Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek combo. Control elements are employed through cards like Counterbalance, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes the CounterTop lock with Sensei's Divining Top and Counterbalance to control the top of the opponent's deck. Additionally, cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Engineered Explosives provide flexibility and answers to a variety of threats. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and win through incremental advantage.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By playing low-cost, high-power creatures like Steppe Lynx, Tarmogoyf, and Wild Nacatl, combined with powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. Additionally, cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Grim Lavamancer provide additional utility and flexibility. The deck's mana base is also carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana for casting spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources and disrupting their game plan with efficient removal and counterspells, while putting pressure on them with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Tombstalker. It aims to quickly deplete the opponent's hand with cards like Hymn to Tourach and force them to play on the back foot with cards like Stifle and Wasteland. The deck is able to adapt to different situations with versatile cards like Brainstorm and Force of Will, while also having some flexibility with cards like Ponder and Sylvan Library to dig for key pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana by utilizing elves and Gaea's Cradle, while also drawing through the deck quickly with cards like Glimpse of Nature and Elvish Visionary. The key strategy is to set up a combo involving Nettle Sentinel, Heritage Druid, and another elf to generate infinite mana and play out the entire hand in one turn, potentially winning the game with cards like Vengevine or Regal Force. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful board presence, utilizing the synergy between the elves and their abilities.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by using a combination of hand disruption, creature removal, and land destruction. It aims to control the game through efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Vindicate, while also maintaining card advantage with Dark Confidant and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary to pressure the opponent. By utilizing a resource denial strategy with Wasteland and land destruction spells, the deck aims to slow down the opponent and eventually overwhelm them with its threats.
